segment.source: OEM and enterprise customers using Windows 10 IoT Core Pro (IoT Core Pro) can take advantage of device management configuration service providers (CSPs) that allow some control over the device update process.
segment.target: OEM and enterprise customers using Windows 10 IoT Core Pro (IoT Core Pro) can take advantage of device management configuration service providers (CSPs) that allow some control over the device update process.

segment.source: Manage IoT Core device updates
segment.target: Manage IoT Core device updates

segment.source: Manage IoT Core device updates
segment.target: Manage IoT Core device updates

segment.source: OEM and enterprise customers using Windows 10 IoT Core Pro (IoT Core Pro) can take advantage of device management configuration service providers (CSPs) that allow some control over the device update process.
segment.target: OEM and enterprise customers using Windows 10 IoT Core Pro (IoT Core Pro) can take advantage of device management configuration service providers (CSPs) that allow some control over the device update process.

segment.source: Note Windows 10 IoT Core (IoT Core) update management only applies to Windows 10 IoT Core Pro.
segment.target: Note Windows 10 IoT Core (IoT Core) update management only applies to Windows 10 IoT Core Pro.

segment.source: For more information about licensing Windows 10 IoT Core Pro, see Microsoft Commercial Terms of Use for Windows 10 IoT Core.
segment.target: For more information about licensing Windows 10 IoT Core Pro, see Microsoft Commercial Terms of Use for Windows 10 IoT Core.

segment.source: Device Management Policy can be set using either the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) tool or a mobile device management (MDM) service.
segment.target: Device Management Policy can be set using either the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) tool or a mobile device management (MDM) service.

segment.source: See Mobile Device Management for more detail about device management protocols.
segment.target: See Mobile Device Management for more detail about device management protocols.

segment.source: AllowAutoUpdate to turn updates on or off
segment.target: AllowAutoUpdate to turn updates on or off

segment.source: Updates for IoT Core Pro can be turned off by setting the AllowAutoUpdate policy.
segment.target: Updates for IoT Core Pro can be turned off by setting the AllowAutoUpdate policy.

segment.source: If the AllowAutoUpdate policy is not configured, devices will get IoT Core updates as usual at 3am.
segment.target: If the AllowAutoUpdate policy is not configured, devices will get IoT Core updates as usual at 3am.

segment.source: If the AllowAutoUpdate policy set to 5, automatic updates for IoT Core are turned off.
segment.target: If the AllowAutoUpdate policy set to 5, automatic updates for IoT Core are turned off.

segment.source: allowautoupdate5
segment.target: allowautoupdate5

segment.source: AllowAutoUpdate to control updates
segment.target: AllowAutoUpdate to control updates

segment.source: The AllowAutoUpdate policy can also control the timing of updates for IoT Core:
segment.target: The AllowAutoUpdate policy can also control the timing of updates for IoT Core:

segment.source: If the AllowAutoUpdate policy is set to 4, IoT Core updates will automatically install and the device will restart at a specified time.
segment.target: If the AllowAutoUpdate policy is set to 4, IoT Core updates will automatically install and the device will restart at a specified time.

segment.source: An IT administrator specifies the install day/time (i.e., every Sunday at 3am).
segment.target: An IT administrator specifies the install day/time (i.e., every Sunday at 3am).

segment.source: If no day/time is specified, the install time defaults to 3 AM daily.
segment.target: If no day/time is specified, the install time defaults to 3 AM daily.

segment.source: All end-user updated related notifications are suppressed as well.
segment.target: All end-user updated related notifications are suppressed as well.

segment.source: View the set time in or in syncml.
segment.target: View the set time in or in syncml.

segment.source: allowautoupdate4
segment.target: allowautoupdate4

segment.source: Deferring updates
segment.target: Deferring updates

segment.source: The AllowAutoUpdate policy can also control the timing of updates for IoT Core:
segment.target: The AllowAutoUpdate policy can also control the timing of updates for IoT Core:

segment.source: Non-critical updates for IoT Core can be deferred for a maximum of 120 days by using Windows Server Update Services (WSUS).
segment.target: Non-critical updates for IoT Core can be deferred for a maximum of 120 days by using Windows Server Update Services (WSUS).

segment.source: In this process, the devices are configured to use the WSUS server for update service instead of Windows Update.
segment.target: In this process, the devices are configured to use the WSUS server for update service instead of Windows Update.

segment.source: The IT admin gets IoT Core updates from the Microsoft Update Catalog and downloads the updates for later deployment.
segment.target: The IT admin gets IoT Core updates from the Microsoft Update Catalog and downloads the updates for later deployment.

segment.source: Note When a WSUS server is configured on an IoT Core device, the trigger to ping the server for updates is suppressed.
segment.target: Note When a WSUS server is configured on an IoT Core device, the trigger to ping the server for updates is suppressed.

segment.source: To configure WSUS on an IoT Core image:
segment.target: To configure WSUS on an IoT Core image:

segment.source: On the Windows ICD Start Page, select the IoT Core project you’d like to modify.
segment.target: On the Windows ICD Start Page, select the IoT Core project you’d like to modify.

segment.source: Under Available Customizations, expand to Runtime settings, then Policies, and then Update.
segment.target: Under Available Customizations, expand to Runtime settings, then Policies, and then Update.

segment.source: In the Policies/Update info pane, change the UpdateServiceURL to the address of the WSUS server that will be used.
segment.target: In the Policies/Update info pane, change the UpdateServiceURL to the address of the WSUS server that will be used.

segment.source: updateserviceurl
segment.target: updateserviceurl

segment.source: To select IoT Core updates in the WSUS catalog site:
segment.target: To select IoT Core updates in the WSUS catalog site:

segment.source: In the WSUS administrative console, select Updates, and in the Actions pane click Import Updates.
segment.target: In the WSUS administrative console, select Updates, and in the Actions pane click Import Updates.

segment.source: A browser window will open at the Microsoft Update Catalog Web site.
segment.target: A browser window will open at the Microsoft Update Catalog Web site.

segment.source: You can search this site for IoT Core updates by device, OEM, and firmware.
segment.target: You can search this site for IoT Core updates by device, OEM, and firmware.

segment.source: When you find the ones you need, add them to your basket.
segment.target: When you find the ones you need, add them to your basket.

segment.source: Go to the basket and click Import to import your updates to the server.
segment.target: Go to the basket and click Import to import your updates to the server.

segment.source: To download the updates directly without importing them, clear the Import directly into Windows Server Update Services checkbox and save the download.
segment.target: To download the updates directly without importing them, clear the Import directly into Windows Server Update Services checkbox and save the download.

segment.source: OS updates only
segment.target: OS updates only

segment.source: An IoT Core device can be set to receive OS updates from Microsoft and not OEM updates by editing the device's feature manifest file.
segment.target: An IoT Core device can be set to receive OS updates from Microsoft and not OEM updates by editing the device's feature manifest file.

segment.source: To configure a device to receive only OS updates, you must edit the OEM Feature Manifest XML for the device.
segment.target: To configure a device to receive only OS updates, you must edit the OEM Feature Manifest XML for the device.

segment.source: The feature manifest for supported devices can be found at the following directory locations on the device:
segment.target: The feature manifest for supported devices can be found at the following directory locations on the device:

segment.source: MinnowBoard Max:
segment.target: MinnowBoard Max:

segment.source: Raspberry Pi 2:
segment.target: Raspberry Pi 2:

segment.source: Qualcomm DragonBoard:
segment.target: Qualcomm DragonBoard:

segment.source: In the DeviceLayoutPackages and Featuressections, remove the device identifier and replace with Generic.
segment.target: In the DeviceLayoutPackages and Featuressections, remove the device identifier and replace with Generic.

segment.source: For example Intel.MBM.DeviceInfo.cab becomes Intel.Generic.DeviceInfo.cab.
segment.target: For example Intel.MBM.DeviceInfo.cab becomes Intel.Generic.DeviceInfo.cab.

segment.source: generic pop on mbm
segment.target: generic pop on mbm
